page.title: 03MONDAY IS MARKET DAY - 1
page.content: A morning in the life of a farmer's wife. Monday is Gloucester market day. Up at 5.30am to help sort out fat lambs and cattle and load them in the lorry for my husband to take to market. By 7.30am he has left with his breakfast, bacon and egg sandwiches, not having had time to sit at table. I help take the sheep back to their field. I look at the other flock, the cattle in the Rough Ground and the cows and calves in Shepherds Leys, not forgetting the mares and foals. Back at the house the coffee pot is a welcome sight. I am ready to enjoy a cup only to be disturbed by the telephone. "Are your cattle out on the road?" asks the caller. "I don't think so I have just looked at our stock, thank you for calling." The morning has flown - lunchtime already.
